COMMAND.TITLE: ls
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: List (shows files and folders in current directory)

COMMAND.TITLE: pwd
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Print Working Directory (Current absolute directory path)

COMMAND.TITLE: cd
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Change Directory (switch the current working directory)

COMMAND.TITLE: touch
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Touch (Creates new file with defined name and extension)

COMMAND.TITLE: mkdir
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Make Directory (Creates new folder/directory with name)
COMMAND.OPTIONS: “.” prefix creates hidden directory -p(create parents as needed)

COMMAND.TITLE: mv
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Move (Moves file contents to new target file (name/location changed))

COMMAND.TITLE: cp
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Copy (Copy file or directory with name/location)

COMMAND.TITLE: cat
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Catenate (Combine file contents and output results onto terminal, just output contents if no combine)

COMMAND.TITLE: echo
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Echo text (Print text after echo on terminal output)

COMMAND.TITLE: clear
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Clear terminal (wipes all terminal commands and outputs for better readability)

COMMAND.TITLE: man
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Manual (Provides detailed page describing command with options)
AndAnd (Chains commands together on a single command line submission)

COMMAND.TITLE: grep
COMMAND.DESCRIPTION: Global Regular Expression Print (Search for character string in documents)
Pipe (Transfer output of one command to an additional file or output)
